item.title: Owning Your Data: Prolog
item.description: I used to be a huge fan of Google’s product offering. I started using Google Chrome around version 2, in 2009 – before it had added support for extensions, themes, or syncing between devices through your Google Account. It wasn’t a juggernaught on the verge of becoming the internet browser; instead it was introduced via a cute interactive digital comic book, had bright blue colors and an icon that imparted a sense of futuristic alien tech, as if it had fallen from the sky into the office of a bunch of Google hackers, who gifted it to the world.
